item.description: Crap, shit, fuck, piz-detz, hui. The future husband Guang Qiu spoke of was named Mo Wudi, the titular character in The Cold Prince Loves me Dearly.

item.title: Brief Foreword
item.description: Rambling Ahead My guilty pleasure is hunting Novel Updates for a [[Webnovel-Recommendations|good time]]. I’m a pretty heavy reader of the transmigration and isekai genres, and while there are things I enjoy about them, there are also things that I find quite annoying about them.

item.title: C-Novel, LightNovel, and K-Novel Recommendations
item.description: Though trying to find a good book in the sea of Novel Updates is often like wading through a sea of trash, there are many shining gems in the genre if one would care to look.

item.title: Chapter 01-Cen Wei the Suspicious
item.description: What are you doing? Jiaojiao ignored the ball of light in favor of peeking through one of the many holes in the front window.

item.title: Chapter 01-Death of an Influencer
item.description: Jiaojiao, beauty blogger, skincare guru, and spokesperson for MEI cosmetics, was dead at the age of 23. The internet celebrity was trending moments after her scheduled Friday stream ended disastrously, having collapsed on camera to the bemused gazes of her supposed fans, just moments from applying the last rhinestone to her bedazzled pinky nail.

item.title: Chapter 02-The Missing Heroine
item.description: There was a heavy silence the moment Jiaojiao spoke to the empty room. Oppressive and somehow, sullen. How did you know?

item.title: Chapter 03-The Cold Prince Loves Me Dearly
item.description: “The Cold Prince Loves me Dearly?” Jiaojiao could barely get the words out through her upset. “You brought me here for this?

item.title: Chapter 05-Bai Jing's Artifact
item.description: Cen Wei soon finished combing Jiaojiao’s hair and retreated with the dented mirror, smile a touch smugger than before. Jiaojiao didn’t care to speculate on the old woman’s inner thoughts, as poisonous as they must be.

item.title: Chapter 06-The Impasse
item.description: Jiaojiao tossed the shovel aside with revulsion and wiped her stinging hands on Cen Wei’s gray robes, paying no mind to Guang Qiu’s enraged screams ringing in her mind.

item.title: Chapter 07-The Stuttering Concubine
item.description: A girl and a glowing ball stood over the prone form of an old woman in a deserted courtyard. The two stared down at the bound figure in silence, neither willing to be the first to speak after their apparent fall-out.

item.title: Chapter 08-Morning and Hu Maoxun
item.description: Jiaojiao’s eyelids creaked open, groaning as the dawn light slashed at her retinas like a scalpel. Distant birdsong filtered through the thin paper window, radiating cold.

item.title: Chapter 09-The Rickshaw and the Clinic
item.description: Jiaojiao, sweaty, irritated, and very unhappy, arrived at a deserted road half a mile from the outer wall of the Bai Estate.

item.title: Chapter 10-The Broken Body
item.description: Jiaojiao sat there, a healthy amount of skepticism making itself known by her unenthused expression as the doctor felt her pulse at her wrist.

item.title: Chapter 12-The Pawnshop
item.description: “Wait, young miss,” a voice came from inside the pawnshop. Jiaojiao found a shadowed alley to her left and made a slow retreat toward it as Bai Xingwu turned to confront the man calling after her.

item.title: Chapter 12-Tu Wenfeng
item.description: “Hand over all your money!” the boy said, pressing the dagger against her neck. His face was stoic, but his voice was young and trembling.

item.title: Chapter 14-The Slum Temple
item.description: Jiaojiao shrunk back as the children crowded around the creaky rickshaw. Their hands reaching for her staff, her robes, her face, and poked curiously at her splinted leg.

item.title: Chapter 15-Rui Si
item.description: Jiaojiao spend a few hours alternating between bickering with Guang Qiu and staring into the middle distance, itching for a phone or some form of internet connection.

item.title: Chapter 16-Leech
item.description: Jiaojiao woke suddenly, when a handful of something wet and smelly landed on her face. She coughed and grabbed at the mess, coming away with a handful of mud.

item.title: Chapter 17-Eat My Shoe
item.description: The next day proved Jiaojiao’s premonition was correct. After a lazy morning, during which she and Rui Si continued producing more leather bracelets, Tu Wenfeng came back right before noon, much less excited than he had been the day before.

item.title: Chapter 18-Blueprint
item.description: “Jiaojiao!” Rui Si kicked Min Tong in the shin and darted over to hide behind Jiaojiao. “Immortal, are you doing, bullying a girl in the middle of the night?

item.title: Chapter 19-A Deal
item.description: “Why do you assume that I’m lying? Because I’m young? Or because I’m a woman?” The man threw back the rest of his cold tea and rose from his seat.

item.title: Chapter 20-The Coincidence
item.description: “Give me back my blueprints,” Jiaojiao said throwing the bag of gold in Dian Zhuo’s face. He caught it an inch from his nose.

item.title: Chapter 20-The Right
item.description: There was a frigid silence as the implications of Mo Wudi’s words hit Jiaojiao like one of Dian Zhuo’s hammer blows.

item.title: Unnamed Book-Blurb
item.description: Bai Jing, assassin of 21st earth, terror of the criminal underworld, reaper of wicked and innocent alike, was dead– murdered by her own lover for her mother’s inheritance.
